display_asset.caption: An arm of the State Department sent this tweet on Wednesday before deleting it and apologizing.

summaries.body: A State Department tweet offering international travel tips drew criticism for appearing to ask Americans to consider their looks on a scale of 10. It was deleted.

display_asset.caption: D’Angelo Russell apologized during a news conference before the Lakers’ game against the Heat on Wednesday.

summaries.body: The Lakers found new ways to be unhappy. D’Angelo Russell apologized for filming his teammate Nick Young apparently confessing to cheating on his fiancée, Iggy Azalea.

display_asset.caption: Whoopi Goldberg has been longtime proponent of marijuana legalization.

summaries.body: Whoopi Goldberg is joining the marijuana industry, with products for women. She is creating a line designed to alleviate menstrual pain.

display_asset.caption: Imre Kertesz in 2005.

summaries.body: Imre Kertesz, a Hungarian Jewish writer and Nobel laureate acclaimed for his semi-autobiographical novels on surviving the Holocaust and its aftermath, has died at 86.

display_asset.caption: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey is the subject of a German-made satirical video deriding his treatment of journalists, the opposition and his country’s Kurdish minority.
display_asset.credit: Kayhan Ozer/Turkish Presidential Palace, via Reuters

summaries.body: A video poking fun at President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey had attracted more than four million views by Thursday after he asked for it to be removed from the Internet.

display_asset.caption: A blood donation center in Lafayette, La. The F.D.A. approved an experimental test to screen blood donations for Zika on Wednesday.
display_asset.credit: David Rae Morris for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Food and Drug Administration announced Wednesday that it would allow the use of an experimental test to screen blood donations for contamination with the Zika virus.
A man filmed a rat as it crawled on the head of another man who had fallen asleep on the subway in New York last weekend.

display_asset.caption: Danielle Kang, a longtime friend of Jenner.

summaries.body: As a teenager, ​Danielle Kang became close friends and golf partners with Caitlyn Jenner, then known as Bruce. On Wednesday, the two shared a special game.
A 72-year-old retired farmer on a flight to Japan attempted to do yoga at the back of the airplane and grew violent when asked to return to his seat.
A 13-year-old lion named Mohawk was killed by Kenyan wildlife rangers after he knocked a man off a motorcycle near Nairobi National Park.

display_asset.caption: Damaris Triana read a book with Phil Young, a volunteer mentor, this month in the library at Washington Elementary School in San Jose, Calif.
display_asset.credit: Gabrielle Lurie for The New York Times

summaries.body: A California public library is owed a whopping $6.8 million in unpaid fines. To combat the problem, it is barring children in greatest need of the library’s resources.

display_asset.caption: An Associated Press photo of the Nazis on the third anniversary of their rise to power, in 1933. That year, the regime hit the press with a restrictive law, but The A.P. was able to report in Germany until 1941.

summaries.body: The Associated Press has rejected a historian’s claim that the news organization cooperated with the Nazis in the 1930s by employing a Nazi photographer.

display_asset.caption: James McBride, at home in Lambertville, N.J., has written “Kill ’Em and Leave,” about James Brown.
display_asset.credit: Andrew Renneisen for The New York Times

summaries.body: A new book called “Kill ’Em and Leave” seeks to chronicle both the pain and the ambition that drove the Godfather of Soul, James Brown.

display_asset.caption: “Why are you here? I will find out,” an anonymous writer said in a threatening letter sent in 2014 to the new owners of a home in Westfield, N.J.

summaries.body: Eerie threats have complicated a home’s sale in New Jersey after the owners of a stately colonial home were harassed by a letter-writer called “The Watcher.”

display_asset.caption: Travelers at Kennedy International Airport in March. Officials advise that when traveling abroad, give a copy of your itinerary to family members or friends.

summaries.body: Is Europe safe for travelers? Yes, experts say, but here are some tips and basic precautions after recent terror attacks.

display_asset.caption: The secretary general of the United Nations, Ban Ki-moon, center, met with Syrian refugees during his visit last week to a camp in Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley.

summaries.body: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon, opening a United Nations conference in Geneva, urged countries to accept about 480,000 Syrian refugees over the next three years.

display_asset.caption: While changes are coming to Instagram, for most people they are weeks or months away, the company said.

summaries.body: Deep breaths, everyone. Yes, Instagram will be changing how it presents which photos and videos you see. No, the change is not happening right now.

display_asset.caption: Questions have been raised about the arrest this month of Glen Grays, 27, a mailman in Brooklyn.
display_asset.credit: Dave Sanders for The New York Times

summaries.body: After a video showed the arrest of an African-American mailman by four police officers in Brooklyn, the commissioner says the officers have been removed from their assignments amid "strong concerns."

display_asset.caption: Tashi Wangchuk, a Tibetan entrepreneur and education advocate, at his home in Yushu, China, in July. Mr. Tashi was detained in January and held in secret until his family was notified this month.
display_asset.credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

summaries.body: A Tibetan education advocate detained in China has been charged with inciting separatism, and could face up to 15 years in prison if found guilty.
Add this to the latest collection of stories about Bay Area residents trying to offset high rents: A man pays $400 a month to live in a box inside a friend’s apartment.

display_asset.caption: Spotify has developed a powerful position in the music industry, helping albums by young stars, among them Ed Sheeran, reach high levels on the charts.

summaries.body: Spotify is about to close on a $1 billion deal that would double the amount of financing it has raised since its founding a decade ago.

display_asset.caption: The Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art plans to convert this former Kraft cheese plant into space for contemporary art.

summaries.body: An Arkansas museum plans to ​transform a Kraft cheese plant into a contemporary art space​ in a project supported by relatives of Walmart’s founder.
A Connecticut woman has filed a lawsuit accusing a surgeon of mistakenly removing one of her ribs.

display_asset.caption: Ms. Locklear looks on as Rhonda Whitmire inspects socks. If there is a customer service issue, Ms. Locklear handles it herself — in addition to ordering yarn, designing both lines, doing social media marketing, processing credit card orders and lying awake nights with worry.
display_asset.credit: Raymond McCrea Jones for The New York Times

summaries.body: Long billed as the sock capital of the world, Fort Payne, Ala., saw its industry collapse with the recent recession — until Gina Locklear's idea put the town back on the map.

display_asset.caption: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, left, and Msgr. Kevin Sullivan this month with one of the Fiat sedans used by Pope Francis during his 2015 visit to New York.

summaries.body: The Archdiocese of New York is auctioning a popemobile that Francis used when he visited the city. Bidding has reached $130,000 — over $100,000 above the car's list price.

display_asset.caption: A mix of tropical and hybrid fruits recently available in the United States.
display_asset.credit: Photograph by Anthony Cotsifas. Styled by Michael Reynolds. Retouching: Anonymous Retouch. Prop assistant: Caleb Andriella. Photo assistants: Karl Leitz and Jess Kirkham. Fruit courtesy of Melissa’s Produce and Frieda’s Specialty Produce.

summaries.body: Mankind has been creating hybrid fruits for centuries. But with new options like the mandarinquat and the baby pineapple we are living in "a golden era of hybridized fruits.”

display_asset.caption: Cody Lee Miller near the top of a giant sequoia tree last week in downtown Seattle.

summaries.body: Using a complex formula calculating trunk diameter and other factors, experts said a man caused $7,800 in damage to a Seattle sequoia that he occupied for 24 hours.

display_asset.caption: A United States Geological Survey map showing its forecast of damage from earthquakes in 2016.
display_asset.credit: U.S. Geological Survey, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Here's a discussion on the threat of earthquakes in California and parts of Oklahoma and Kansas by Times reporters Adam Nagourney and Michael Wines.

display_asset.caption: Secret Service agents during a rally for Donald J. Trump at Valdosta State University in Georgia last month.
display_asset.credit: Kevin D. Liles for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Secret Service said it would forbid attendees to carry firearms at the Republican National Convention in July, neutralizing a debate over gun rights.

display_asset.caption: Matt Harvey, who last pitched Thursday against the Astros, will not start Tuesday’s game.

summaries.body: The Mets' Matt Harvey was treated for a blood clot in his bladder, but is expected to make the opening day start Sunday at Kansas City.
